definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: In a recession, the individual learns that there are countless ways to economize.
sentences.chinese: 在衰退期，個人學會了不計其數的省錢的辦法。

sentences.english: Today it has responsibility for determining the beginnings and ends of recessionary periods.
sentences.chinese: 如今它也被賦予了明確此次衰退期起止的責任。

sentences.english: What we can do is to minimize the damage to our economy during this downturn.
sentences.chinese: 我們能做的是在此次衰退期使經濟損失最小化。

sentences.english: If the US economy enters a rece ion it may derail the economic recovery in the Asian region.
sentences.chinese: 如果美國經濟進入衰退期，亞洲各地經濟勢難復甦。

sentences.english: In degenerate stage, the cytoplasm completely disappeared, and the function was lost.
sentences.chinese: 衰退期篩管分子細胞質完全解體消失，失去功能。

sentences.english: The Yuan and Ming Dynasty is a declining period in the course of the Epigraphy development.
sentences.chinese: 元明兩代是金石學發展過程中的相對衰退期。

sentences.english: The leaders know that when they get through this recession, they'll need employees,' Avramidis said.
sentences.chinese: 頭頭們知道一旦度過這段衰退期，他們還需要員工。

definition: to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
